title: How to Drive a Golf Ball Straight

steps.title: Tee the ball high.
steps.content: Tee the ball high. Put your golf tee in the ground only slightly. [1] X Expert Source Michael Metz Golf Instructor Expert Interview. 24 February 2022. Place your golf ball on your golf tee. A high tee will allow you to strike the ball on the upswing. Get the most distance from your swing by using a high tee.

steps.title: Put the ball high in your stance.
steps.content: Put the ball high in your stance. Stand so that the ball is aligned with your left toe. Swinging from this stance will allow the largest swing. Make sure the ball isn't beyond your left foot.

steps.title: Take a wide stance.
steps.content: Take a wide stance. The further your feet are apart from one another the more range of motion you will have. [2] X Expert Source Michael Metz Golf Instructor Expert Interview. 24 February 2022. This large range of motion will translate into power behind your swing. [3] X Research source Keep your weight equally on both feet. Keep your head behind the ball.

steps.title: Grip the club high.
steps.content: Grip the club high. Use leverage to put more power behind your shot. Hold the club higher up, towards the end of the grip, to maximize this leverage. [4] X Research source Gripping the club up high allows for power at the cost of accuracy. Make adjustments to your own body and club size to find the best grip.

steps.title: Draw the club up and back.
steps.content: Draw the club up and back. Shift your weight onto your right foot. Keep your eye on the ball. [5] X Research source Don't use too much back-swing. [6] X Research source Bring your head further behind the ball.

steps.title: Swing!
steps.content: Swing! Bring the club down and hit the ball. Strike the ball from beneath, on the upswing of your club. Make sure the club face is striking the ball directly in the center. [7] X Expert Source Michael Metz Golf Instructor Expert Interview. 24 February 2022.

steps.title: Tee the ball halfway.
steps.content: Tee the ball halfway. Place your golf tee in the ground with some depth. Put your golf ball on the tee. Use about half of the tees length. Teeing too high or low will alter your drive.

steps.title: Put the ball low in your stance.
steps.content: Put the ball low in your stance. Stand so that your golf ball is only a few inches behind your left toe. Placing the ball here will result in less swing range and more control. Setting the ball back further in your stance will diminish power. Putting the ball further ahead in your stance will reduce accuracy.

steps.title: Take a narrow stance.
steps.content: Take a narrow stance. Stand just wider than shoulder width. Taking a narrow stance will constrict your range of motion and grant more control. [8] X Research source Don't take too short a stance as this will drastically alter your swing.

steps.title: Grip lower on the club.
steps.content: Grip lower on the club. Place your hands a bit lower down on the grip area of your club, away from the clubs end. Gripping down further on the club will give you more control over its movement as you swing. [9] X Research source Low grips will trade power for accuracy. Keep your hands and wrists as straight as you can.

steps.title: Pull the club up and back.
steps.content: Pull the club up and back. Keep your weight distributed evenly, shifting only slightly to your right foot. Keep your head and torso straight and centered with the ball. Bring the club back at a moderate speed.

steps.title: Swing!
steps.content: Swing! Send the club down, swinging towards your ball. Strike the ball slightly under its center and with the midpoint of your swing. [10] X Expert Source Michael Metz Golf Instructor Expert Interview. 24 February 2022. Make sure you strike the ball with the club face flat. [11] X Research source Swing strongly, but don't overdo it.
